I'm trying not to look at the stats but its so tempting and so disheartening. Someone has probably asked this already but is there anyone else out there with liver mets still going strong?? Thanks for listening xx Dx 12/18/2011, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIB, Grade 3, 2/12 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Dx 8/26/2013, IDC, 3cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 2/12 nodes, mets, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: liver mets - are you out there? Huntsco Mamita49

Posts.Content: Dec 7, 2013 01:14AM Huntsco wrote: Hi there Many thanks for touching base, it gives me a little hope to hear of others out there. Every day is still a darn struggle I seem to be somewhere between the living and the dying.  I look at my children and apologise (in my head) for putting them in this situation.  Its like I'm looking from the outside at this thing that's happening that's not really happening but it is (???). Ive brought future cards and journals for my children and I cant start writing them.  Im sorting, chucking, selling and tidying.  Ive rearraged the linen cubboard so my DH can find everything easily.  What's that all about?? Be positive I tell myself, take one day at a time I tell myself.  Have fun I tell myself. Oh its so hard. Ok here I go, my multiple and diffuse tumors have reduced by 40% in my liver.  My side effects are manageable, Im still at work, my 4 year old has dry pants and is no longer wetting the bed, my 6 year old is learning to swim and is loving it, we played mini golf today and I forgot I was living with cancer for one whole hour and my niece loved me so hard the other day I thought my heart would burst. Delaina-hugs to you too and yaaaaa for your one year!!
Posts.Title: liver mets - are you out there? Huntsco Mamita49

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2013 12:26PM Huntsco wrote: Hello everyone, Thank you for getting in touch it certainly gives me hope and the hugs and listening do help! I'm having MMM chemo at the moment third one coming up. I cant seem to find anyone else on the dicussion boards on this chemo too - maybe a new Zealand thing??? Also have it a little in my bones (hot spot) in spine but they don't seem to be worried about that at the moment. After the first chemo, my liver function tests were better (were very very abnornmal prior) but still abnormal so a glimmer of it working. I will be after a scan after my third so will be very nervous about that. I'm yet to have a liver biopsy to see if my status has changed- currently ER +, PR - and Her2-. But given tamoxifen and the chemo didn't seem to work very worried I might be ER- now. Im having trouble making my diagnosis etc public, have the little sign on public, but not showing up-so will play around with it. Angela, love the poem. Great to see other new-bees (trish, dancingvegg)joining in to read this thread and get hope from others who have got in touch. Anyone else out there? xxK

Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2013 11:45PM Huntsco wrote: Dragon girl, thank you so much for your wise words.  Only recently diagnosed with liver and bones meets Im struggling too.  I have read you post over and over,  all the way over here in New Zealand. I'm working on "Accept the things you can not change (you have BC), change the things you can (how can I change my life to LIVE BETTER), and have the wisdom to know the difference. The better you get at that, the easier your days will become". Thank goodness I have found this placce to come. Once again thank you DG. Take care

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2013 04:54AM Huntsco wrote: Hello there Just checking in also for support as a fellow kiwi-Wellingtonian.  I have also recently been diagnosed with multiple liver mets and bone mets in Aug this year.  Not sure if you know about molecular testing - send away the biopsy for testing in USA to match chemo with tumor type.  Unfortunately costs a bit $7,000 aus. Not huge in NZ but being used a lot in Australia. Do let us all know how your going or PM if you like
